# Ariwara clan

The  was a Japanese noble family of imperial descent.
Name
The name of the clan can also be read in Arihara.
History
The clan was initially formed during the K≈çnin era (810-824) in the reign of Emperor Saga when the two sons of , Yoshifuchi and Yasusada, were granted the name "Ariwara." In 826, following a request by Takaoka's brother , the latter's sons Yukihira, Narihira,  and  were also given this name. The descendants of Narihira, a great waka poet, continued to flourish. However, the clan remained politically obscure due to pressure from the powerful Fujiwara clan.
